user.description: Explore the universe and discover our home planet with @NASA. We usually post in EDT (UTC-4).
user.name: NASA
user.tweets:
Join tonight us at 10pm ET to talk about our @PlanetQuest ‚Äì the search for strange new worlds! Live Q+A:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/lnGTrrbeFa RT @POTUS: That is out of this world. Thanks, @NASA. https://t.co/R8CSjAwt2E Tomorrow, 2 astronauts perform the 2nd of 2 spacewalks to upgrade @Space_Station power systems. Watch at 5:30am ET:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/B0qI5m9qQA 8 years may not be long when dealing w/ galaxies light-years away, but our space program marches on:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/SgF80Jo1ew .@NASAKepler mission confirmed 2,331 planets outside our solar system, including an Earth-sized one:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/DJ8WwTssNc Launched in 2011 on a 10-month trip, @MarsCuriosity sent this selfie from 33 million+ miles away:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/Oh9cvqXmlU RT @MarsCuriosity: Signed, sealed, delivered. I carried @POTUS‚Äôs signature to the surface of #Mars. https://t.co/YThE6o82e3 #NASAPast8Years‚Ä¶ In #NASAPast8Years, we've worked to improve efficiency, reduce environmental impact & maintain safety in aircraft:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/w1D1fJbYSU From 1 MILLION miles, EPIC camera returned its 1st view of the entire sunlit side of Earth in 2015:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/7NPGxYP6d1 Our @NASAJuno spacecraft arrived at Jupiter in July 2016 to study the gas giant and its formation:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/EF2x7g1iCq The 1st craft to fly by Pluto, @NASANewHorizons has discovered everything from ice to mountains:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/fT1HPyDkEy How does microgravity impact the human body? Our #YearInSpace mission helped us get the answers:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/EVNdXvgynv Commercial companies @SpaceX & @OrbitalATK now deliver critical supplies & science to @Space_Station‚Ä¶ https://t.co/eSy393wWLa Commercial partners already send cargo to @Space_Station & will soon carry our astronauts there too!‚Ä¶ https://t.co/RF51HxaxbL ‚ÄúMars was always 40 years away, or 30 years away. But today, it‚Äôs closer than ever before‚Äù. -NASA Admin Charles Bol‚Ä¶ https://t.co/3wE1Xj5v84 Today we celebrate the career of NASA Administrator Bolden w/ a retrospective. Narrator @LevarBurton‚Ä¶ https://t.co/uOayTVvhuN Today our Administrator & Deputy are saying farewell to employees. We‚Äôre taking the day to highlight‚Ä¶ https://t.co/tpeXhgv08C RT @astro_kimbrough: Good morning USA! Tampa ‚Äì St. Petersburg ‚Äì Clearwater, #Florida https://t.co/bGix9gTBDM RT @Thom_astro: Hello @Bordeaux! Some of my family enjoy your way of life year-round. I get a 2 minute glimpse of you flying at 28 000 km/h‚Ä¶ Close-up view of a day in the life of a rather small active region on the sun shows activity of its magnetic field:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/NblbahYn14 On @Space_Station, even the dust floats, a problem that can cause allergic reactions. We're working on a solution:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/jBOXeOTDR7 RT @NASAJPL: Touchdown! 12 years ago this week, @ESA‚Äôs #Huygens probe landed on the surface of #Saturn‚Äôs moon Titan https://t.co/sSDterHZcu‚Ä¶ EveryWear lets astronauts monitor their health like we do on Earth & the iPad app lets them easily download data:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/yRq5WktHcm Working in space! @AstroPeggy installed new battery adapters & electrical connections on @Space_Station last week:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/f7Q7Cw4plf RT @astro_kimbrough: Good morning USA! Philadelphia - Atlantic City - #NYC. https://t.co/1ZI4eAT9Wf Space recycling may be a key to building on Mars. We want ideas as part of a $2.5m 3D printed habitat competition:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/ZILlCbgQRx Houston, we have questions! Walk through Mission Control with Flight Director Mary Lawrence before her shift starts‚Ä¶ https://t.co/f46EYcAFTM @satishGsharma More details can be found by clicking the hyperlinks within the text. They'll take you to the web page with more info. @Abrh4m @Abrh4m Of course! Clicking on the hyperlinks within the text will bring you to the web page with the full info, including months! We use the vantage point of space to better understand Earth. What does the changing planet look like? Take a peek:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/ohIQHt32uc .@NASA_Hubble took this image of two doomed gas-rich spiral galaxies slowly and destructively merging into one:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/eESjY0UWeo RT @Thom_astro: Cameras are always at the ready in the Cupola. You never know: Might find yourself over Mount Everest or the Caribbean sea‚Ä¶ Construction is complete on @NASA_SLS structural test stand, and we're gearing up to test the rocket‚Äôs fuel tank:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/KV9aDiubWA Snow and rain storms affecting the Pacific Northwest can be seen here in this satellite animation from Jan. 6-9:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/qPI8xXRG9A RT @OrbitalATK: The #OA7 PCM has arrived at @NASAKennedy! We are targeting a March 16 launch date for the OA-7 mission aboard a @ulalaunch‚Ä¶ Solar System This Week: See our home planet from Mars, learn about three new science missions and more! Joshua Tree from @Space_Station! Tweet your questions tomorrow at 10am ET and tag‚Ä¶ https://t.co/hpS6CZAuMx @BenDMahon The Lucy spacecraft, with NASA's approval, will have the ability to visit other bodies, but Psyche will stay at it's target. @MannyFresh130 @NASAJPL These missions will help us understand how planets form throughout the Milky Way. @Des_bravador Our @NASA_LSP program will evaluate mission needs and find the right launch vehicles to send them on their way. @jnosanov New Frontier missions will be evaluated independently of this announcement of Discovery missions. @Gardunooo The 6 Trojans being visited are in a stable orbit with 4 in front of and 2 behind Jupiter. @MarcinTheOne Lucy will be doing flybys @OurWorldcomic There's way more asteroids out there than could have been made from the shattering of planet Psyche @iamJoeyW Once their primary mission is complete, NASA will evaluate any options for the future. @secretestmoons Absolutely! Scientists hope so. Some small bodies are known to have satellites. We have plans to observe & see what we find @LukeMcMillian Congress appropriates money one year at a time, so funding for NASA missions is decided one year at a time. @JayAlver It's too early to tell what the possibilities may look like. Stand by! We‚Äôre going where no other spacecraft has gone before! Learn about our two new asteroid science missions. Take a look at this year‚Äôs top 16 photos:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/toHlNsW4vH 2016 was a busy year on @Space_Station, with launches, spacewalks & out of this world science! Watch for highlights‚Ä¶ https://t.co/ykxBvuhFAg Guess what?! #ThisHappened at NASA in 2016! Check out some of our big moments from the past year:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/2P6kTF56c0 In 2016, we drove advances in tech, science, aeronautics & space exploration that enhanced the world‚Äôs knowledge:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/eDKrlmPoCk As 2016 comes to a close, we take a look back at what we‚Äôve accomplished & how it will set us ahead in the new year‚Ä¶ https://t.co/h1WPJqXPeL What happened this year at NASA? We progressed on sending humans on a #JourneyToMars, plus much more! Watch here:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/A2Pwb3dzyQ There‚Äôs #space in your life! @NASASpinoff features space tech that's transformed into commercial products/services:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/W0ERlx0Eo9 @tvvilightzone Yup. We sure did mean @NASASpinoff (no underscore). Thanks for catching our error. @CBielstein It's @NASASpinoff (no underscore). Thanks for catching our error. Need some tunes? Listen to @ThirdRockRadio, America‚Äôs space radio station. Tune in here: https://t.co/8RsMD4Rrbj https://t.co/LydLWjre7v 1st deep space maneuver‚Ä¶‚úÖ! Our asteroid sample return mission, @OSIRISREx, is now on course for Earth flyby in 2017‚Ä¶ https://t.co/JVXuDrbfdD At a distance of 923,834 miles away, our home planet looks like a giant blue marble. Pic taken 12/27 by EPIC camera‚Ä¶ https://t.co/SkmDQokYFr RT @Thom_astro: The tropopause usually limits the vertical extension of clouds ... except for the most massive and daring ones ;) https://t‚Ä¶ We're ready! Work platforms inside @NASAKennedy's Vehicle Assembly Building are nearly done for @NASA_SLS rocket‚Ä¶ https://t.co/fvr4nMqiEA RT @Space_Station: Electronic Nose analyzes the atmosphere inside the space station to provide rapid, advanced warning of potential contami‚Ä¶ Basking in sunlight. Northern region of Saturn is bathed in sunlight in this late 2016 view from @CassiniSaturn:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/jdEoAN38UY At any given time, ~70% of Earth‚Äôs surface is covered by clouds, giving a beautiful glimpse of our atmosphere. Look‚Ä¶ https://t.co/MwYGgVe7oE .@NASASunEarth scientists used computer-generated models to portray magnetic field lines of the sun from Dec. 13-16‚Ä¶ https://t.co/jRw3r9FPlj RT @NASA_Johnson: Controllers flying the @space_station recently moved into an upgraded facility. Take a look back at the flight control ro‚Ä¶
user.tweetsFollowing: How far are those far, far away galaxies? This vast new catalog contains info on over 100 million of them! Look:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/tpJiwR4qrF Arrived in Cali for my @NASAJPL visit to see amazing science and engineering, but also art, like this Deep Space N‚Ä¶ https://t.co/CZFgJp3chZ This star, recently found by astronomers, may be missing link in understanding the evolution of how stars die. Info‚Ä¶ https://t.co/EKILwnl6I0 Heading to @NASAJPL tomorrow to participate in meetings about @NASAEuropa, @NASAMars2020 and @NASAInSight, etc and‚Ä¶ https://t.co/CdRCprBbt0 .@NASA uses the unique vantage point of space to understand how Earth is changing. Check out these images of change‚Ä¶ https://t.co/KwCvps3eVF Spending some time at the @airandspace to talk about @NASA programs and our joint-passion to inspire! #hubble #space https://t.co/afF4IHixMH Shadow Play‚Ä¶@NASA_Hubble may have found a planet by a shadow that‚Äôs sweeping over a disk of gas & dust near a star‚Ä¶ https://t.co/UwxyP8FkzJ Some @NASA spacecraft only take one week to build - well at least using LEGO... @psychemission @ltelkins via James‚Ä¶ https://t.co/RSZtf24nLQ Stephen Hawking has given voice to the great heights that humanity can achieve. Happy 75th birthday!‚Ä¶ https://t.co/lURPfxyDdf .@alanstern This is not likely to happen when you land in #DC. If the humidity is high enough, you might have snowf‚Ä¶ https://t.co/3X7lyMAG1j

Join me now for my Facebook Live: https://t.co/gpPyML3Fge https://t.co/KUAId9JedF Ask me Q's during my Facebook Live tomorrow 11:30am ET https://t.co/jqxLxnrzp7 I will chat about photography and m‚Ä¶ https://t.co/keH7omuztZ I will certainly miss this view! Vast gratitude toward my crewmates, ground teams, supporting friends, and family. https://t.co/op9vFyWSFT RT @Space_Station: 3 crew members return to Earth Tuesday. This is the view from their office on orbit. https://t.co/92i5zS82eN https://t.c‚Ä¶ Prominent clouds cast their long shadows on the horizon. Hi-res here: https://t.co/Q9tguuKrfz https://t.co/AtokhnYuxd Sail down the Hudson River into New York Harbor, one of the largest natural harbors in the world. https://t.co/B6euMuqHFN Clear day over a busy New York Harbor several weeks ago. Hopefully more sunshine in store as #Hermine drifts away. https://t.co/8yQqz7Rwev Beautiful canyon structures of Ahmar Mountains, Ethiopia. Hi-res here: https://t.co/5PVD7VWTH9 https://t.co/NVMDKzJ7zf I love the story of this glacier, Perito Moreno. More about the rupture cycle in my FB note: https://t.co/CYMav2ekrC https://t.co/WqrhyslePO Great way to start your Sunday‚Ä¶ setting moon, rolling aurora, and the break of dawn. https://t.co/vDbzruldiE

Great tribute to our NASA Administrator Charlie Bolden https://t.co/SenHduLoJa A big milestone to have this arrive @NASA_Johnson https://t.co/OQbrmt9wMj Will be talking about aerospace, energy and medical collaboration with Pumps & Pipes colleagues #tamest2017 @TAMESTX Listening to TX university presidents talk about sustainable education at #TAMEST2017 @TAMESTX https://t.co/YgHxMZDjmw RT @HiddenFigures: Thank you for making #HiddenFiguresüöÄ the #1 movie in America! https://t.co/QpFq8DD5yv RT @NASA: Houston, we have questions! Walk through Mission Control with Flight Director Mary Lawrence before her shift starts: https://t.co‚Ä¶ RT @Astro_Stephanie: Honored to have been at the NY premier of #HiddenFigures which opens today about the work of Katherine Johnson & other‚Ä¶ Great job by @AstroPeggy @astro_kimbrough and the whole team today! https://t.co/DLeaJT1J9P RT @Space_Station: .@Astro_Kimbrough and @AstroPeggy go outside Friday at 7am ET to upgrade station power systems. https://t.co/xnTKpclMRO @CaswellTess @Space_Station @NASA_Johnson @TheEllenShow She must follow @Space_Station on Twitter!

Learn more about UNOOSA Director @SDiPippo_OOSA's vision for space and more... https://t.co/lyBr2Jyq9W The annotated provisional agenda for the Scientific & Technical Subcommittee (30 Jan - 10 Feb) of #COPUOS is online: https://t.co/ZYvofgGxQ9 Hear UNOOSA Director @SDiPippo_OOSA discuss her career, leadership, and women in STEM: https://t.co/gkoGWZ8HA5 Applications for UN/Japan fellowship programme on nano-satellite technology close on 22 Jan. Apply now! https://t.co/YQbII8cbFl Welcome to IATA as the newest permanent observer to #COPUOS! @IATA https://t.co/ApTB94Q13y Kia ora New Zealand! We‚Äôre pleased to welcome you as the newest Member State of #COPUOS @NZinVienna @MFATgovtNZ https://t.co/1gOTdk166I Happy holidays from the UNOOSA team! RT @SDiPippo_OOSA: It was great to hear our new #UNSG speak about gender equality at the opening of HERstory exhibition last week (image: U‚Ä¶ RT @Space_Station: Space station crewmembers @AstroPeggy, @Astro_Kimbrough, and @Thom_Astro wish the people of Earth happy holidays from 25‚Ä¶ UNOOSA maintains the UN register of space objects, a valuable snapshot of space history. You can search it here:‚Ä¶ https://t.co/DkuTpORAgH

RT @DrHughLewis: Visualisation of the satellite & #spacedebris population I made for recent BBC film using @SpaceTrackOrg catalog: https://‚Ä¶ JSpOC ID‚Äôd debris event near DMSP 5D-2 F12 (23233) @1549z, 23Oct. 1 piece, which is now in routine conjunction analysis. Cause unknown. JSpOC ID‚Äôd debris event near FY1C DEB (#29957)-occurred at 1117z on 6Oct. 8 pieces, no known cause. Debris-causing event ID'd near RISAT-1(#38248) on Sep 30: 16 pieces, 15 decayed. Will catalog last piece on Oct 6. No known collision risk. RT @RoyalAirForce: RAF #space operators are taking part in a multi-nation @US_Stratcom exercise in Virginia this week: https://t.co/1FqrLQU‚Ä¶ JSpOC tracking 5 small debris due to Sentinel 1A small particle impact, as ID‚Äôd by @ESA on 23 Aug. Visit https://t.co/sSyG8NZ8QH for info. Another SL-12 R/B breakup! #29680 on 27Jul16. 6 pieces as of 2000z 28Jul16. No indication of collision. RT @NOAASatellites: Spanning 5 decades, GOES-3 has done it all! More on this historic satellite's amazing life @ https://t.co/waTipUMclB ht‚Ä¶ 19 Jul: JSpOC ID‚Äôd debris causing event related to @DigitalGlobe WorldView-2; 8 debris pieces but WV2 confirmed operational & maneuverable! 41599-Cartosat; 41602-GHG; 41605-MSM; 01-Sky; suspect 00 and 07 are Swayam and Sathyabama; 21 is adapter; so 03-Lapan, 04-Biros, 06-Flock?
